page.title: 18BLACKMORE VALE MIXED FARMING
page.content: 0375/0116 is pasture except for one arable field occupying about a quarter of the square.The land carries milking and breeding Friesian cattle,also pigs The pasture is cropped for silage and hay.A few horses are kept on pasture. The old field footpaths seem generally disused.A population of about fourteen includes four retired people and two children.The rest are mainly concerned with agriculture.On the NW-SE road are five dwelling-houses with gardens. A big farmhouse is reached by a lane which runs from the north-south road. The area has excellent local transport making approximately thirty outward journeys weekly. A disused line of the old Somerset and Dorset Railway runs under Kings Mill Bridge to the north-east of the area and,in parts,is a refuge for wild-life.
